Retrieve one of your phones by its id

parameters.name: phone_id

schema.title: Phone ID
schema.description: The unique identifier for the phone

parameters.description: The unique identifier for the phone

patch.description:
Change the agent associated with a phone. It requires a valid agent_version_id, that
will publish the version of that agent. If a agent has already a published version, it will
use that version instead of creating a new one.

delete.description:
Release a phone number.

- For Netelip (purchased) numbers: Adjusts the subscription schedule
- For custom (imported) numbers: Deletes LiveKit trunks and removes from database

The behavior depends on the phone's telephony provider.

Note: Phones in RESERVED status (pending verification) cannot be released.

post.description:
Purchase new phone numbers for the company.

For verified companies, this creates a subscription-based checkout session.
For unverified companies, this creates a one-off captured payment checkout session. In this case, the money
will be held until the company is verified, at which point the payment will be captured. If the verification
does not happen within a certain period, the reserved phone numbers will be released and the payment intent
cancelled.

Import a phone number from an external SIP provider.

This endpoint allows you to use your own phone numbers with custom SIP trunks.
The phone number will be created in the system and linked to your company
with the provided SIP configuration.

Note: Custom/imported phone numbers cannot be shared between companies.
Each imported number is exclusive to the importing company.

description.title: Description
description.description: The description given to the agent

prompt.title: Prompt
prompt.description: The prompt given to the agent

greeting.title: Greeting
greeting.description: The greeting message said by the agent to the caller at the beginning of the call

time_before_start.title: Time Before Start
time_before_start.description: The time in seconds before the agent starts to speak

voice_id.title: Voice Id
voice_id.description: The voice id to be used by the agent

voice_speed.title: Voice Speed
voice_speed.description: The speed of the voice used by the agent, beeing 1.0 the normal speed. Values lower than 1.0 will make the voice slower, while values higher than 1.0 will make the voice faster

boosted_keywords.title: Boosted Keywords
boosted_keywords.description: he list of keywords that are boosted for the agent speech recognition. Use this to improve the agent's recognition of domain-specific terms. For example, `['bradycardia']`

language.title: Language
language.description: The language used by the agent. Use `multi` for the agent using both english and spanish in the same call (multi will expand to more languages in the future)

max_reminder_count.title: Max Reminder Count
max_reminder_count.description: The maximum number of reminders that can be sent to the caller. If not provided, the default value is 3. When reached the last reminder, the call gets hang up. Set this value to 0 to disable reminders

reminder_frequency_ms.title: Reminder Frequency
reminder_frequency_ms.description: The frequency in milliseconds to send reminders to the caller. If not provided, the default value is 7500. Set this value to 0 to disable reminders

reminder_messages.title: Reminder Messages
reminder_messages.description: The list of messages to send to the caller as reminders. If not provided, the default value is an empty list which makes the model to generate the reminder messages by itself. Please, note that when using an empty list, the `reminder_frequency_ms` can be a little bit higher than specified since it has to generate the messages

knowledge_base_ids.title: Knowledge Base Ids
knowledge_base_ids.description: The list of knowledge base ids available for the agent to use

mode.title: Agent Mode
mode.description: The mode of the agent. Can be 'free' or 'path'

conversational_path_id.title: Conversational Path Id
conversational_path_id.description: The id of the conversational path used by the agent.

version_name.title: Version Name
version_name.description: The name of the created version

integrations.title: Integrations
integrations.description: The list of integrations and their tools to assign to the agent

call_tools.title: Call Tools
call_tools.description: The list of call-tools (built-in tools) to assign to the agent

dynamic_variables.title: Dynamic Variables
dynamic_variables.description: Agent-level dynamic variables for template interpolation

background_audio.title: Background Audio
background_audio.description: The background audio to be used in the calls that this agent handles

pronunciation_dict.title: Pronunciation Dictionary
pronunciation_dict.description: Custom pronunciation mappings using phonetic text substitution. Keys are words (case-insensitive), values are phonetic spellings. Example: {'API': 'A P I', 'SQL': 'sequel', 'Nguyen': 'nwin', 'async': 'a sink'}. The TTS will pronounce the phonetic spelling instead of the original word.

PhoneRegisterStatus.title: PhoneRegisterStatus
PhoneRegisterStatus.description:
Enum representing the status of a phone number register. The cycle is as follows:
- RESERVED: The phone number is reserved for a certain amount of time before being assigned
- ASSIGNED: The phone number is assigned to a company
- RELEASED: The phone number is released from the company and is pending availability for purchase (30 days before it can be purchased again)
- FINISHED: The phone register process is finished, and the phone number is available for purchase again. Once a phone number reaches this status, it cannot return to previous statuses.
